presetPlanItem.description: 1. Review the aims of the study and their relationship with the investigation goals, hypotheses, and assumptions.

customisedPlanItem.description: 1. Review the aims of the study and their relationship with the investigation goals, hypotheses, and assumptions.

planner.contactDetails: Computer Science Dept, Aberysswtyth University, Wales, UK
planner.name: Nigel Hardy

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.

presetPlanItem.description: 2. Verify the general understanding of data mining goals, and tasks as discussed earlier (see section 3.3).

customisedPlanItem.description: 2. Verify the general understanding of data mining goals, and tasks as discussed earlier (see section 3.3).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.

presetPlanItem.description: 3. Decide the type of the intended objectives. The objectives can be either hypothesis- driven, based on the aims of the metabolomics study, or data-driven, based on the general understanding of data mining approaches (see section 3.2).

customisedPlanItem.description: 3. Decide the type of the intended objectives. The objectives can be either hypothesis- driven, based on the aims of the metabolomics study, or data-driven, based on the general understanding of data mining approaches (see section 3.2).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.

presetPlanItem.description: 4. Derive the modelling objectives depending on the type of data mining intended: (a) Hypothesis-driven objectives should be derived from and consistent with the goals of the original investigation, the research hypothesis and assumption, and the aims the metabolomics study. i. Analyse the relationship between the data mining approaches, goals, tasks, and techniques on one hand, and the aims of the metabolomics study on the other hand. Examples from the metabolomics literature are demonstrated in table 6.1 and section 6.2.1; ii. Translate the aims of the metabolomics study into definable data mining modelling objectives, based on the general understanding of data mining goals and tasks (see section 3.3); (b) Data-driven objectives should be derived from the general goals of data mining goals and its subsequent tasks (see section 3.2); i. Analyse the potential of the targeted dataset and its associated meta-data (if available) for fulfilling possible data mining goals and tasks as illustrated in figure 3.2 (see section 3.3). A more detailed data exploration can be performed later in phase 3; ii. Translate the data mining general goals and tasks into narrow and more specific data mining objectives;

customisedPlanItem.description: 4. Derive the modelling objectives depending on the type of data mining intended: Data-driven objectives should be derived from the general goals of data mining goals and its subsequent tasks (see section 3.2); i. Analyse the potential of the targeted dataset and its associated meta-data (if available) for fulfilling possible data mining goals and tasks as illustrated in figure 3.2 (see section 3.3). A more detailed data exploration can be performed later in phase 3; ii. Translate the data mining general goals and tasks into narrow and more specific data mining objectives;

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. The objectives should be expressed, either in a hypothesis-driven or data- driven fashion. Hypothesis-driven objectives are derived from the aims of the metabolomics study, while data-driven objectives are derived from the goals of data mining and its subsequent tasks.

presetPlanItem.description: 5. Assess the derived objectives achievability using the available data mining tech- niques (see section 3.4) and the targeted metabolomics data in terms of its suffi- ciency, adequacy, and relevance.

customisedPlanItem.description: 5. Assess the derived objectives achievability using the available data mining tech- niques (see section 3.4) and the targeted metabolomics data in terms of its suffi- ciency, adequacy, and relevance.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.

presetPlanItem.description: 6. Assess the derived objectives feasibility in light of the process management and technical constraints.

customisedPlanItem.description: 6. Assess the derived objectives feasibility in light of the process management and technical constraints.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The objectives must be feasible. It must take into consideration the process man- agement constraints, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructures.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The objectives must be feasible. It must take into consideration the process man- agement constraints, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructures.

presetPlanItem.description: 7. Depending on the results of the assessments in steps 5-6, decide whether to go to step 8, or to consider alternative objectives by going back to step 4.

customisedPlanItem.description: 7. Depending on the results of the assessments in steps 5-6, decide whether to go to step 8, or to consider alternative objectives by going back to step 4.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The objectives must be feasible. It must take into consideration the process man- agement constraints, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructures.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The objectives must be feasible. It must take into consideration the process man- agement constraints, including: time, cost, and expertise as well as the availability of the software and hardware infrastructures.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 5. The fulfilment of the objectives must be measurable and the success of their achiev- ability must be testable.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The fulfilment of the objectives must be measurable and the success of their achiev- ability must be testable.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 3. The objectives must be realistic and achievable using data mining techniques in general (see section 3.4) and using the targeted metabolomics data, which must be sufficient, adequate, and relevant to the aims of the metabolomics study in order to test an implied hypothesis, or to discover a new knowledge.

presetPlanItem.description: 8. Define the data mining objectives of the process and their success criteria.

customisedPlanItem.description: 8. Define the data mining objectives of the process and their success criteria.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Defining the data mining modelling objectives for metabolomics.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Defining the data mining modelling objectives for metabolomics.
